welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “What do you think a script does in a game? Can you think of something a game character does that might need instructions?” Students write examples and share.

aim.data: Agenda/Objectives: Understand the purpose of GDScript in Godot 4; Learn how to attach and edit scripts using the Godot Script Editor; Write and test basic GDScript code.

review.data: Recap from Lesson 1.3 on the Godot editor layout, including scene tree, Inspector, and running a project. Ask: “Where do you think the logic goes when the player jumps or collects coins?”

relevant.data: Mini-Lecture & Demo: Introduce GDScript; Compare GDScript syntax to Python; Show how to attach a script to a Node; Demonstrate creating a Label node and writing a script that updates its text.

interactive.data: Guided Practice: Students follow along to create a 2D scene with a Label node; Attach a script to the Label; Modify the text in _ready(); Add a second function that updates the label when called.

ownership.data: Student Application: Students add a Button node to the scene and write a script that changes the Label’s text when clicked. Students test and troubleshoot in pairs.

resonate.data: Exit Ticket: Prompt: “What does the _ready() function do? Why do we use it in GDScript?” Collect short written responses or use a quick poll on the board.

supplies.data: Computers with Godot 4 installed; Projector or screen-sharing setup for demo; Optional starter project with Label and Button; Access to instructor script templates or slides.
